column4: hello how do I login remotely to my ubuntu computer if im using ssh?
k where do I find it?
i cant believe its that easy
I have a friend who wants to host something on my linux box, so I created a user account on the box
would my friend be able to log on remotely?
or do I need something else?
You have ssh on your windows box?  I suggest PuTTy.  But, it should work fine (assuming thats the syntax).  Make sure you've port forwarded properly if you're behind a router
You don't need 22 open on the client box, just the server box.  It already is open on the server, you just need to forward if you're doing the router thing
If you're both behind the same router, you won't need to forward to reach it (just go to the LAN ip of the server)
right, for that you'll need to forward port 22 in the router to point to your server
The nice thing about using sudo over su is you can give him access to certain things, and not others (apt-get but not fdisk, or whatnot)
You'll need to hand-edit your sudoers, but yes.
